{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 If \b selected\b0 , unauthorized personal data of everyone falling under the data subject\f0  \f0 type\f0  \f0 is \f0 eligible for cleanup. \f0  \f0\par
\par
\b Note:\b0  This setting is valid only if \b Data cleanup of unauthorized personal data\b0  \f0 d\f0 atabase \f0 task allows for data cleanup of the data subject.\f0  \f0 This task will anonymize/remove personal data of subjects without updates to their data processing purposes. This can be verified in the \b\i Data Subject Analysis \b0\i0 window by examining the \b Purpose Information Updated \b0 field.\par
\par
\b WARNING:\b0  Selecting this check box might result in \b irreversible massive data loss\b0 . Excercise caution!\f0\par
}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 If \b selected\b0 , personal data management is active for the data subject. This means that the \b Valid Data Processing Purpose \b0 check box will appear on the main definition windows and management data processing purposes will become available through a righ-click action.\f0\par
}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 Business Object in IFS Applications classified as a possible Data Subject" (according to Personal Data Protection legislation). Data Subjects are natural persons who can be identified, directly or indirectly, by ID, location online identifier or one or more physical factors (physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural, or social identity).\f0\par
